column4: So, odd problem, I installed the new fglrx (and the one before that) using Envy (and any other possible means I could track down on ubuntuforums / wiki), but I can't get DRI to work. No failure reported in the XOrg log, just glxinfo reports "Direct Rendering: No". The fglrx kernel module is loaded. When I remove these drivers and install the older fglrx in the Feisty (AMD64) repo, then I get DRI. Anyone had this problem before?
Envy is a terrible thig to do to your computer and it is not supported in here
Have you reinstalled since you tried it..?
your operating system..
We cant just forget it... that is where the problem started
It has to do with proper video driver and monitor setup.
ONce you use envy or automatix I cant help until you reinstall.. It is a waste of my time
or you could just maybe think of what might cause the problem
You did not get your video AND monitor setup correctly in the beginning.  Most people forget they need to setup the monitor sync rates and keep messing with video drivers
They get lazy and try scripots that dont work many times...  then they want to find the right way to do it.
Once you go outside the repos using the scripts it messes up oter things down thew road..
Read that link about some of what those scripts do.
It is relevant...  no matter what you say...
I already did...
Did you ever setup your monitor info in your xorg?
Post it to the pastebin
So you dont listen ...
Again, if you seem to know so much and it dosent work why not listen to what we tell you
we link res and tell people how to set things up.. yet they dont read...
We link pages about how bad scripts are, yet they wont read..

Do we need to say AGAIN, that you used Envy.  something that changes your system in ways that are not easy to fix and cause horrible problems..  So please read that to mean   NOT recommended or supported.
aptitude
